item.title: The First Descendant: 6 Beginner Mistakes To Avoid
item.description:
The First Descendant follows similar storylines in other looter shooters such as Destiny . There is an evil trying to steal power from the world, Karel, and he has an unstoppable army to do his bidding. Players can join up with the rebel alliance in the hud zone of Albion to help stop Karel and his goons.

That’s the general premise of The First Descendant but there are artifacts, magic, and other shenanigans abound. Story aside, some players may begin the game and get lost. There are a lot of menus and it can be hard to start on the right foot. That’s why these tips may be extra useful to avoid unnecessary mistakes.

6 How Descendants Works

Getting More Characters And Loadouts

When players start The First Descendant , they can choose between three characters who are known as the titular Descendants. Viessa is a good starting character as she has ice powers and other than skills and different stats, all Descendants operate the same way. Most weapons and most Modules, which are like armor chips, are universal. After choosing a Descendant players will be locked in for the first several hours.

At the home base in Albion, the game will tell players they can get new Descendants whenever, and then a micro-transaction window will pop up. Don’t make the mistake and be tempted to buy a new Descendant right away. Players can unlock more Descendants as they gather materials and enough in-game cash. Bunny, for example, can be unlocked as players follow the tutorial story. Also, levels and equipment transfer between Descendants so players don’t have to worry about leveling them all separately.

5 Go Back To And Explore Albion Frequently

Unload Gear And Upgrade Mastery Ranks

Players only have a set amount of gear they can carry around which is standard for a looter RPG. Players should warp back to their home base at Albion frequently to offload weapons and Modules into storage. If there are unwanted amounts of gear, they can always sell it too.

One easy shortcut players may miss is that they can tag unwanted gear as trash. That way players can sell all “trashed” items at once to save time. There are other reasons to head back to Albion frequently like to level up Masteries. There is a bar in the equipment menu that will tell players when it is time to visit the Mastery vendor in Albion, located on the East side of the compound. Not cashing in Masteries will result in wasted EXP and that’s never good in an RPG.

4 You Can Examine Gear On Many Levels

Take A Look At Weapon Types

There are a lot of pickups players can gather on the battlefield from ammo to weapons to Modules. It can be a lot to keep track of as is typical in a looter RPG. For example, there are eleven types of weapons in the game from various rifles to shotguns which appear in many shooters. Some players may not realize this but in the weapon menu, for example, players can look at every type individually.

This categorization may help them decide on what to equip next. It’s also handy to note that there are four ammo types with the aforementioned shotguns using High-Power Rounds while assault rifles use General Rounds. The three weapon slots available are for any type of gun, so if players wanted they could equip three shotguns. It’s not locked in, unlike other looter shooters including Destiny .

3 Matching Elements With Characters

Equipment Is For All, But It Shouldn’t Be

This same type of organization can be done in the equipment menu concerning Reactors and External Components. Reactors are the big pieces of gear to equip as they can raise a lot of stats and grant various boosts. While stat boosts are great for all Descendants, each one has a core elemental power.

For example, the aforementioned Viessa can use ice skills while Bunny can use electric-based attacks. Equip a Reactor to match their needs to boost these elements. It doesn’t make a lot of sense to equip a Reactor to Bunny that boosts fire powers, for example.

2 Don’t Forget About Verticality

Put That Grappling Hook To Good Use

This game is set up like a typical third-person shooter with various types of gear, weapons, and so on. It may not occur to players that they have a grappling hook since it doesn’t play into the core gameplay besides some needed platforming for missions. It’s an easy mechanic to forget but the grappling hook can help a lot during combat and is one of the highlights of The First Descendant .

For example, players could grapple up to a tall building and then become a sniper for the team. It can come in handy in a pinch too like an extra way to dodge attacks, especially during colossal boss battles. It’s a good idea to practice with the grappling hook but most importantly players should not forget about it.

1 Check Out Your Journal

Achievements Lead To Rewards

There are a lot of menus besides equipment that players have to parse through. One overlooked menu can be the Journal tab. Here, players can find mini-quests which will lead to rewards. They’re kind of like in-game achievements similar to Trophies on PS5.

They can range from completing story missions to defeating enemies in a certain manner like inflicting status ailments. If there is a reward to be claimed, there will be a red dot on the category. It might not be a bad idea to study some of these achievements to play in different ways thus leading to unlocking rewards faster. No reward is a bad reward in The First Descendant .

item.title: Genshin Impact 4.8 Livestream Redeem Codes
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Genshin Impact 4.8 Livestream Codes
  • How To Redeem Genshin Impact Codes
  • Primogems In Genshin Impact

Primogem is the primary resource Genshin Impact players would need to get new characters and weapons. The easiest way to get this currency is obviously by spending money to buy Genesis Crystals and convert them into Primogems, but the most affordable way is by being active, following every in-game event, and, of course, hunting additional Primogems from web events or codes.

Some redemption codes are released at a fixed interval. For instance, three livestream codes are always announced every six weeks, and new redeem codes are available at the start of every version. If players are wondering which Genshin Impact redeem codes are currently available, they can refer to this article.

Genshin Impact 4.8 Livestream Codes

Here are all the Genshin Impact 4.8 livestream redeem codes:

  • YS2WHUHFNQ5M - 100 Primogems + 10 Mystic Enhancement Ores
  • 5TJWHDHX7R59 - 100 Primogems + 5 Hero's Wits
  • [TBA] - 100 Primogems + 50,000 Mora

  • RTJUNRSHTAL9 - 60 Primogems & 5 Adventurer's Experience

How To Redeem Genshin Impact Codes

There are several ways players can redeem Genshin Impact codes:

  1. Visit the official website https://genshin.hoyoverse.com/en/gift
  2. Use the redeem codes button from the in-game setting

Method 1

For the first method, visit the official website, then do the following:

  1. Log in to the HoYoverse account that matches the target Genshin account
  2. Select the appropriate server that contains a profile
  3. Paste the code in the Redemption code box, or simply press on the provided link, and this box will be filled automatically
  4. Press redeem

Method 2

For the second method, open Genshin Impact , and once it loads, follow these steps:

  1. Go to Paimon’s menu
  2. Press Settings
  3. Go to Account
  4. Choose Redeem Code
  5. Input the available Genshin Impact redeem code
  6. Press Exchange

Primogems In Genshin Impact

Primogems can be used for several things, but players commonly spend it on wishing banners to get the characters or weapons that they want. Other than this, the currency can also be used to recharge Original Resin or buy Battle Pass level . Each Battle Pass level costs 150 Primogems, and will stay at this rate even if players buy 50 levels at once. Meanwhile, Original Resin recharge gets more expensive over time and is capped at six times per day.

Daily Refill Primogem Cost
1 50
2-3 100
4 150
5-6 200

Each refill will grant 60 Resin, so in total, players can get 360 Resin at the cost of 800 Primogems.

To get Primogems in Genshin Impact , the most reliable and affordable source is the Daily Commission and Welkin subscription. However, other sources like Spiral Abyss, Genesis Crystals, Battle Pass, Events, Adventure Rank rewards, achievements, and HoYoLAB check-in are also available.

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: Where To Find Mulan's Key
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Mulan's Key In Disney Dreamlight Valley
  • What Does Mulan's Key Unlock In Disney Dreamlight Valley?

Disney Dreamlight Valley 's Lucky Dragon update opens up a whole new Mulan-themed realm to explore with various quests to complete. While these quests give you many different items, perhaps one of the trickiest to get is Mulan's Key. When you progress through the Mulan Realm in Disney Dreamlight Valley , you might find yourself scratching your head and wondering where to find Mulan's Key as an objective near the end of one particular quest from this Realm. The objective asks you to search the Realm for a key to unlock Mulan's storage chest. However, this is a pretty large area to search, especially when compared to other realms in the game.

When you enter the Mulan Realm, you'll probably spot Mulan's orange treasure chest upon completing the first quest in the Realm called A New Recruit. Fortunately, you don't have to go too far to find Mulan's key, as the precise location isn't too tricky to spot once you know which area to search.

Where To Find Mulan's Key In Disney Dreamlight Valley

Mulan's key is a collectible quest item that unlocks Mulan's personal storage chest in the Mulan Realm. You can find Mulan's chest outside Mulan's tent near the cooking stove and close to the second realm exit point.

However, you won't be able to find the key to unlock Mulan's chest until you reach close to the end of Disney Dreamlight Valley' s Clearing the Road quest. This involves clearing up the aftermath of a landslide and ends with players receiving a gift from Mulan as a reward, which is where Mulan's key comes in.

Mulan's Key Location

You can find Mulan's key north of the second camp entrance . This is the entrance that takes you past the rockslide area, rather than the entrance where you first entered the camp.

Head up the path to find a group of wooden carts towards the end. You should be able to see Mulan's Key on the ground near some rocks by its golden sparkles. Collect the key, and return to Mulan's storage chest to see what's inside.

What Does Mulan's Key Unlock In Disney Dreamlight Valley?

When you open the chest using Mulan's key, inside you can grab a reward called Mulan's Surprise . Open it to find the Defender's Sword , which is a decorative furniture item that you can place indoors as a wall decoration.

Upon completing Clearing the Road, you can then welcome Mulan and Mushu to the Valley once you've built a house for them and begin their Friendship questlines.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for July 6, 2024
item.description:
Quick Links

  • The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #125 for July 6, 2024
  • New York Times Games Strands Clues
  • Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands
  • The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands
  • Today's Strands Explained

Strands has yet another challenge for word-search fans today. In the 6x8 grid of letters, there are six words hidden that you will need to find in order to win. But it can be a difficult puzzle game, even with the built-in hint system.

If you already know how to play Strands , and you are stuck on this one, you can find hints below. In this article, there are general clues, word spoilers, an explanation for how the themed words and the clue match up, and even the full answer if you want to see it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #125 for July 6, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue By the Yard . There are six total items to find, including one Spangram and five themed items.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

Three clues for this PC puzzle game can be found in the sections below. These won't spoil any of the words in the puzzle, but they will help you get closer to the theme.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

In the two sections below, you can find one spoiled word along with its position in the puzzle. If you want to see one or both of these, press the Read More buttons underneath each one.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you just want to see the full answer for this challenging puzzle game, you can open up the expandable section below. Inside, you can find all the themed words and each of their locations in the letter grid.

Today's Strands Explained

The full explanation for the New York Times Games Strands is located in the expandable section below. Open it up to see how the clue, the Spangram, and the themed words all go together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Tales of the Shire: The Argument For and Against A Romance Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Tales of the Shire is a Hobbit-focused cozy sim game exploring Middle-earth through a new lens.
  • The game could introduce in-depth relationship mechanics, including romantic relationships, a first for Lord of the Rings games.
  • While romantic relationships have appeared in the films, books, and Amazon series, they've never been the focus, and adding romance to Tales of the Shire may feel out of place for some fans. Still, it would suit the cozy genre very well.

After Return to Moria took Lord of the Rings to the survival crafting genre, Tales of the Shire is set to once again deliver a new type of Middle-earth game. This time, that will come in the form of a Hobbit-focused cozy sim, which sounds extremely promising. The concept will not only let players experience Tolkein's world through a new lens, but will also let them further explore just what it means to be a Hobbit. On top of that, Tales of the Shire may have another exciting opportunity when it comes to love.

As of now, Lord of the Rings has not really dabbled with romance much. While there have been romantic relationships throughout the series, they have never been the focus. But, Tales of the Shire could change all of that as it will be taking the series to the cozy sim genre, which is often known for having more in-depth relationship mechanics. If done well, that could lead to something wholly unique for this iconic fantasy franchise when it comes to video games, though it may also feel a bit out of place.

Tales of the Shire Could Be Middle-earth's Chance at Love

Tales of the Shire Feels Tailor-made for Romance Mechanics

One of the core features of any cozy sim game is the relationship-building that players must do as they progress. Animal Crossing: New Horizons sees them grow closer to their animal villagers, Stardew Valley lets them get married and start families, The Sims is all about creating those relationships, and even Disney Dreamlight Valley lets them bond with iconic Disney characters. No matter the game's theme, some type of relationship mechanic tends to be included. As of now, there is seemingly no reason Tales of the Shire will be different.

There is a strong chance Tales of the Shire features some type of friendship mechanic, but it should not stop there. Players should be able to actually experience what living as a Hobbit is like, so they need to be able to actually forge romantic relationships with other villagers. Additionally, those relationships could be made even stronger if they resulted in actual families. Couple that with the cute nature of Hobbit culture, and it could lead to something truly special for Lord of the Rings fans to enjoy.

Middle-earth Has Never Been Known for Having a Romantic Side

At the same time, romantic relationships in Tales of the Shire may feel a bit out of place. For the most part, the Lord of the Rings series has never focused too much on the romantic side of its world. Obviously, characters have formed romantic relationships and even built families, but none of those stories spend too much time in the spotlight, with the focus often being on the One Ring or the fight against darkness. So, while there is no reason that it has to be the case for every project, romance may also be a step too far for some.

Although Lord of the Rings has never let romance be the main focus of its stories, there have been a few notable romantic relationships throughout the franchise that have had a lasting impact, like Aragorn and Arwen, Sam and Rosie, and Durin and Disa, among others.

Tales of the Shire is already a major change for Middle-earth, as it has never really had a cozy sim set within its world before. In the past, Lord of the Rings video games have either been action-adventure or RTS titles, with the occasional unique title thrown into the mix. That makes this new game stand out immensely, which means it may already have a bit of a hard time convincing fans to make the jump over. If it made romance a central feature, that may put off some die-hard fans completely.

Still, if given the chance, Tales of the Shire could do a lot of interesting things with romance, and the cozy genre is a much better fit for it than an action game like Middle-Earth: Shadow of War . Ultimately, it is up to Weta Workshop if it wants to take the risk of adding romance, as there are surely fans who will be for and against its inclusion.
